summary: Completed comprehensive end-to-end testing of the Film Schedule application. Backend API testing: 9/9 tests passed. Frontend testing: All core functionality working correctly including project CRUD, inline editing, multi-day schedules, row management, column width controls, and project browser. Minor UI issue found with dialog overlay blocking interactions after delete confirmation.

backend_issues.notes: All backend endpoints working perfectly. No issues found.

minor_issues.issue: After confirming project deletion, the dialog overlay can remain and block subsequent interactions with the Browse button
minor_issues.workaround: Press Escape or click outside to close the overlay

minor_issues.issue: CSV export button is enabled for unsaved projects (should be disabled). However, clicking it shows proper error toast 'Please save the project first', so functionality is protected.

accessibility_warnings.issue: Missing Description or aria-describedby for DialogContent components
accessibility_warnings.note: Console warnings about accessibility - not affecting functionality

passed_tests: Backend: Health check endpoint - Database connected
Backend: Create project with proper ID generation
Backend: Update project and add new days
Backend: Export CSV with DD-MM-YYYY date format
Backend: Auto-archive projects with past dates
Frontend: Initial page load and default project structure
Frontend: Inline editing of project name and notes
Frontend: Inline editing of all schedule fields (time_from, time_to, scene, location, cast, notes)
Frontend: Reset column widths to default
Frontend: Project browser dialog with active/archived tabs
Frontend: Text wrapping with long content
